description: a(n) = sum of lengths of the iteration sequences of Euler totient function from 1 to n.
comments: Partial sums of A049108. - _Joerg Arndt_, Jan 06 2015
references: P. Erdos, A. Granville, C. Pomerance and C. Spiro, On the normal behavior of the iterates of some arithmetic functions, in Analytic Number Theory, pp. 165-204. Birkhauser, Basel, 1990.
links: P. Erdos, A. Granville, C. Pomerance and C. Spiro, On the normal behavior of the iterates of some arithmetic functions [Broken link]
Harold Shapiro, An arithmetic function arising from the phi function, Amer. Math. Monthly, Vol. 50, No. 1 (1943), 18-30.
example: Iteration sequences of Phi applied to 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 give lengths 1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 3 with partial sums as follows:1, 3, 5, 9, 13, 16 resulting in first...6th terms here.
prog: (PARI) a049108(n)=my(t=1); while(n>1, t++; n=eulerphi(n)); t;vector(80, n, sum(j=1, n, a049108(j))) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 06 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 13 2001
